conclusion: Predict which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Containers A, B, and C are at the top, releasing liquid.
Baffles (angled barriers) are placed in the middle to redirect the flow of liquid.
Containers D and E are at the bottom, ready to collect the liquid.
Liquid from A (cyan color) flows straight down and hits the purple baffle, which redirects it to the left, toward container D.
Liquid from B (yellow color) flows straight down and hits the gray baffle, which redirects it to the right, toward container E.
Liquid from C (blue color) flows straight down without hitting any baffles and directly into container E.
Container D will collect liquid from A (cyan).
Container E will collect liquid from B (yellow) and C (blue).
Liquid will flow into Container D from A and into Container E from B and C.
